content.question: A dentist uses a concave mirror with radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to examine a tooth. The dentist holds the mirror a distance <math alttext="R over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> from the tooth. The image observed by the dentist is

choices.label: virtual, inverted, and smaller than the tooth
virtual, upright, and larger than the tooth
real, inverted, and larger than the tooth
real, upright, and smaller than the tooth

content.answer: virtual, upright, and larger than the tooth
